Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgauss
Reviews.Content: A classic hotel - downtown, old monastery, close to plaza and cathedral. Short drive to zoo. Easy parking. Plenty of restaurants within a few blocks. Internet works near the lobby, which is a nice space with coffee, bar, and cafe. Limited breakfast but free.

Reviews.Title: “3 DAYS IN MAYAGUEZ”
Reviews.Author: Treadman46
Reviews.Content: Located at city center, part of this hotel is an old monastery. The room in that part of the building are large and very nice. The rooms in the other part of the building are not so nice. Wireless interest is only available in the lobby and the complimentary continental breakfast does not about too much but there is a very inexpensive bakery 1/2 a block away. They do charge a resort fee and you do not receive much for your money. A very small pool and the limited internet access. There is also a parking fee which you can easily avoid. Plenty of street parking is available right across from the entrance if you arrive after 6:00pm. Parking during the daytime is a problem. The parking lot for which you pay $8 per day is located offsite about 1/2 block away. There is a small on site cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: tocororo83
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located at a great location in central Mayaguez. The optional parking fee is very inexpensive for a hotel of this rating and the service is excellent. The hotel carries complementary continental breakfast but lacks a computer with Internet access at the lobby. Town square is one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: heather b
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, and a great place to come back to after day trips. In the heart of the city. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Ummmmm.stinky”
Reviews.Author: tmjmccormack
Reviews.Content: My wife thinks there was mold in our room. I know one thing for sure - we stayed here three nights and I never looked forward to returning to the room bc of the smell. It was absolutely pervasive. It was serious chemical smell mixed with mold I think. Whatever. It was cheap and we were locked in with a no refunds agreement. Don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “No great options in Mayaguez”
Reviews.Author: greenbeltdan
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Mayaguez for years, and this is the first (and last) time that I'll stay with HoJo. It's got a central location and a renovated lobby, but that's it. No wireless in rooms? No cable for wired internet? No fitness center? No clock in the room? Awoken by bloodthirsty mosquitoes, cars smashing into each other, and a Glockenspiel (charming when it's not 6:00 a.m.). Given - the Holiday Inn and Mayaguez Resort aren't the Ritz, but both are better options for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “I'll keep it simple it's cheap and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Wiqui
Reviews.Content: Very clean. The room has modest accommodations but well beyond expectations at its price point. There were no towels but a quick call to the front desk solved the problem quickly. Staff is very friendly. Hotel is located in the middle of downtown Mayaguez.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs to improve rooms”
Reviews.Author: vmorales122
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the lobby is very clean and modern. However, the room had a bad mold odor and there was also mold in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ideal for visiting Plaza Colon”
Reviews.Author: BJRMilmay_NewJersey
Reviews.Content: We were intrigued by the restored monastery, and loved the huge columns and walkways on each floor. My husband was born in Mayaguez, but last there 45 years ago and knew little of the building. The rooms are not fancy, but we are more interested in character and ours was clean and comfortable. The location is perfect for seeing the Plaza, the Cathedral, nearby bakeries and the Yaquez Theatre. The continental breakfast if more than adequate, but we didn't get to try the bar. We were there in early December and had no idea how beautifully the Plaza and surrounding buildings would be decorated. If you can go to Puerto Rico that time of year it is wonderful and walking the Plaza, seeing the families with their children, was a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of roon in the old building”
Reviews.Author: theTruth_OK
Reviews.Content: The overall stay was very good. I would not say excellent because I believe that it was overpriced for what you get. Its like an expensive motel. You get exactly what you get in the motel, for the exception of a comforter. The staff and overall service was excellent. BEWARE of rooms in the old building. Even if the are for non-smokers they DO smell. These rooms are tiny and musty.

Reviews.Title: “Former monastery makes for great hotel”
Reviews.Author: OneDreamer
Reviews.Content: We were attending a destination wedding in Rincon and stayed at the Mayaguez Howard Johnsons instead of the beach resort hotel in Rincon. The Hotel was across the street from a beautiful church and the plaza. There were a couple of restaurants and a bakery near by. The hotel staff was friendly, and accommodating. The room price included a continental breakfast and everyone, ( the folks at the bakery, the plaza police who gave us directions, the staff at the restaurant that was two blocks away, and the local barber shop), was friendly and spoke English. Parking was free and safe. There was a parking lot for guests one block up. We rented a car and drove to the resort, which was 7 miles away. There is a Kmart on route 2 north and quite a few Walgreens stores. Our room had a queen size bed, a flat screen TV and channels in English and Spanish. The Hotel was clean, quite, and overall a great place to stay. The church bells rang every morning at 6 am. We were a party of 4 and had two rooms. We all agreed that our accommodations were good and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't feel bad if you miss this one, but it gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: RainDelay
Reviews.Content: This hotel effectively produces a chic urban vibe. The lobby is a modern coffee shop/ wine bar. The prices are fair and the beer selection (while not expansive) is excellent. The kitchen staff were accommodating and loaned me a good knife so that I could cut fruit in my room. They also made a delicious steak wrap. It smelled so good when my wife and I checked out that we bought one for the road even though we had been recently satisfied by the adequate continental breakfast. Don't be immediately satisfied with the "best rate" if you arrive without reservations. At first the friendly desk attendant said the room was $100 before taxes and fees, then a few minutes later while I was on my laptop preparing to book the room for less at an online site, he told me he could I could get a rate of $95 that included taxes, parking, and breakfast. The highlight of the hotel is the pool. The official hours say the pool closes at 7 PM, but my wife and I took a swim around 9:30 PM and nobody seemed to mind. It was nice to soak and admire the architecture of the hotel and neighboring church. We had an interior room -directly across from the pool. This location was convenient to the lobby and limited street noise. The room smelled a little bit musty and had a few cockroaches, but was otherwise clean. It housed a wooden armoire, which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “VERY IMPRESSED!”
Reviews.Author: aj_for_success
Reviews.Content: this isn't my first time staying in puerto rico,however this is my first time staying in a QUALITY hotel that treated me with respect and a very clean,nice and affordable room....i recommend this place to any and everyone with a budget,but also want's somewhere nice and clean to stay,centrally located within all the attractions,thank you howard johnson mayaguez staff! :) P.S. - the church bells are not as LOUD as everyone make's them out to be....it's actually very nice and comforting.

Reviews.Title: “Historic HoJo in the Heart of Mayaguez ' Town Square - Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: RedCarnationReady
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico is so diverse and after tiring of San Juan, we road-tripped it "Out West" and found the many small towns charming, quiet and eventually, we felt like locals. Here at this hotel you can count of cleanliness, safety and a pleasant place to stay, Rooms are well-air conditioned, have flat screen TV's and we thought our view of the mountains was super! Sure, the pool is really just a place to take a dip but you can drive to a beach. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Surprised in Heart of Charming Mayaguez!”
Reviews.Author: GringaGrrrl
Reviews.Content: My friends and I wanted to take an overnight trip from San Juan to Cabo Rojo on the West side of the island...we knew it wd be a long trip so we decided to make Mayaguez our spot to sleep before heading to that area. First of all, the town square in Mayaguez is completely charming, feels like you're in Spain. The Howard Johnson itself is housed in a former Monastery and the Main Lobby is very hip and modern, there's a small nice bar area/check in area and that is where a Continental Breakfast is served until 10AM on weekends. The room was CLEAN, updated and had great air-conditioning and...we loved the balcony room we had overlooking Plaza Colon (the town square). We weren't expecting much, but we were wowed from the moment we walked in! Ricomini Bakery is across the street, wonderful pastries and Cafe con Leche. The small local bar called "La Casita" was a nice place to try the local beer (Medalla Light) at $2.00/bottle...and when you tip the appreciative Bartender, he rings a bell! Sweet sweet little town. I'd definitely return to this Howard Johnson again; Safe, Clean, Great Location and the BEST idea for a midway stop to Cabo Rojo I ever had! Thank you HoJo!

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Marien07
Reviews.Content: We were a group and had 3 rooms. Our room was a double with a balcony overlooking the Central Plaza and church. We were skeptical about staying there but it was the only hotel in town with availability. We were pleasantly surprise. The rooms were newly decorated, very clean & the staff was friendly. Continental breakfast was included. Parking across the street and pool for the kids. The single rooms had no view (view to a wall), but again they were spacious and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! No Frills amenities (amenities available but nothing worth getting excited about. - Read Honest review)”
Reviews.Author: PapiSwing
Reviews.Content: Its slightly above average. There are better hotels in Mayaguez but none so close to midtown. The other two better hotels are located just off the highway near nothing of importance. I've read the other reviews which are a bit dated. The main difference is there no manhole or reconstruction taking place anywhere nearby nor is there any complimentary breakfast nearby. Here are the Pros and Cons: Pros: Just a block away from the Town Plaza, Not noisy at all, Helpful staff, Best Value for your money Cons: You get what you pay for, Complimentary breakfast is weak, Pool only 3'6" deep. Apx., 20' X 20' wide. very small Restaurant and dining area very weak. [Breakfast should still be obtained at bakery across the street to the right at your expense. (in my opinion)] Parking is available; A small block away but its also a public parking as well. (The cost of parking will added on to your bill at check out.) Night life is dull in the immediate area. The Bar is "OK", the restaurant is not worth even mentioning. Occasional panhandling surounds the exterior area of the hotel and parking. Parking is not so expensive but is usually at or above capacity during business hours. Despite the cons mentioned above it is worth the value. Recommendations: (A) You'll want the parking. You have to give them a card when you leave and obtain a card when you park (a bit backwards). Its worth it so accept all the dilemma and it will make it easier. (B) Most anywhere you travel you'll have panhandling. Its an international vacationing fact. Most Panhandlers aren't threatening Anything no more than 25 - 50 cents is usually enough. Pre-count your change at the hotel. Always have some in hand and make sure you keep your quarters in one pocket and the rest in another. You choose which pocket to pick from. (C) unless you enjoy a simple meal for one, avoid eating at the hotel. it is a clean area but not made for family dining. Dining area is by the lobby and front desk so you decide. My advice, enjoy the bakery nearby and/or any restaurant in town. Vicinity locations to be aware (as you step out of hotel): Ricomini bakery. -to the right of Hotel Corner shop, bikinis taylor made fit -to the left Rex Cream. Chinese churned ice cream (try Maiz flavor with cinnamon) -front of parking. Marine World, Local surf and beach clothing store. -across street from Rex cream, past parking (Same street) Cathedral, Town Plaza & City Hall. Behind and to the right of Hotel. Free Trolley Ride - To the right of City Hall Finally- for a real shopping experience try -Mayaguez Mall (Mayaguez South), -Mayaguez Shopping Center [2nd floor (Near Town University)], -Mayaguez North Mall (Near local airport off Hwy Rt. # 2) all shopping areas mentioned above have ample parking and less than a 20 min. drive. Mayaguez Mall has the most to offer but if you want to enjoy a movie try any of the other two. [For NEW movie releases at $6.50 a pop that's quite a bargain (in english for the most part)] None of the other better hotels can say they have so much, so close. If staying in Mayaguez and not planning to leave the hotel much stay at the better ones. If not, Howard Johnson's is your best value for shopping or if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very helpful, room quality poor. Found better furnishings at Salvation Army.”
Reviews.Author: netzero827
Reviews.Content: Although the location was good, the poor room condition was inexquiseable. The pool was nothing more than a hot tub. It was only 3 ft. deep. Nobody was ever seen using it. The mildew smell in the room was not pleasant. Our shower stopped functioning on the last day of our stay. The door was dragging on the floor when a screw fell out. The breakfast consisted of stale bagels, coffee, and orange juice, cold cereal. If you wanted an egg omelet, you had to pay 5.00 for one and it wasn't worth it. Your best bet was the bakery across the street. The wait time there was long as it was very busy. You could even get lunch there. Our bed cover had a hole in it from what looked to be a cigarette burn. That should have at least been replaced. We got only two towels on our last day here. There weren't any washcloths included in the room until we bought our own at K-Mart. When they saw we bought our own, they started including one for us. We left the maids tip in the hole on the bed cover. I hope they got the hint. They did clean the room properly. All the trash was emtied and soap, shampoo were left in the bathroom. There is no refrigerator in the room. There is a washer and dryer, mind you, only one of ea. where you could do laundry for 2.00 to wash and to dry which was about the only convenience.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Mayaguez”
Reviews.Author: HonestyandtheTruth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean. It can be a bit too cold so bring a sweater. The lobby is pretty and has a wide variety of food. They have free breakfast and a small pool. When you enter the elevator, you can see outside. The rooms are very well kept with extra fleece blankets, free shampoo, conditioner, soap, and lotion. The showers feel great! When on the balcony, the view of PR is beautiful. I was on the third floor, but if you go all the way up to the fifth floor, the view is priceless, with beautiful mountains. The downside is, is that you can only receive wi-fi in the lobby and the floors can be very slippery when wet from the people walking from the pool. There are great stores outside as well a souvenir shop. And a great bakery across the street. I am definitely going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: TedMakeover
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night via the website. We printed our confirmation which said "free wifi internet and free breakfast". When we checked in we asked where the breakfast will be served and then we heard that there was no breakfast. But the price was unchanged. I think we were lucky if I read the other reviews on this hotel. We had breakfast across the street at the bakery which was delicious. The free internet worked only in the lobby. The room was very small but with a/c, flatpanel tv (with poor picture quality) and a safe. The doors of the room are on the outside of the hotel with an open connection to the street. This makes the rooms very noisy. And the hotel is next to a church that has a belfry, which is very nice of course but not if they use it at 6 a.m! The pluses: free valet parking and the hotel is in the absolute center of Mayaguez. When we checked out the next morning they needed my credit card again because the girl who checked us in made a mistake or something. That did not feel very comforting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel priced right”
Reviews.Author: slafrance3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HJ Downtown Mayaguez on a family vacation to PR. While the location is a little down, the hotel itself was perfect for what we needed. The room was a bit small for a family of 4, but it is right across the street from a beautiful town square and church, and a Ricomini Bakery on the other side. The hotel even gave us coupons for breakfast there! We were just using the hotel to sleep and the beds fit the bill without a problem. The water was hot with plenty of pressure. We had adequate towels and pillows and the TV worked as expected. As I said, as a place to sleep for the night, this place was great and the price was perfect. Mayaguez is also the perfect jumping off point for anything you want to do on the west coast of the island. The highlights of our stay here however were the town square and church on one side of the hotel, which is beautiful photo op in the evening, with a statue of Columbus, the church, and town hall. On the other side, the bakery is the place to eat. You can get "comida criollo" (local food), baked goods, dessert, and sandwiches. We ate farina, pork chops, mofongo, chicken, rice and beans, and sweet plantains, 3 different kinds of flan, and ordered sandwiches to go, plus drinks for everyone for about $24.00. We had food for the whole day for less than the price of one meal at a higher end restaurant, and it was all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do it!!”
Reviews.Author: 2happypeeps
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the Ricomini bakery accross the street and the location. While it is true you get what you pay for at this hotel you got nothing! The front desk clerk could not make a room key properly we waited over an hour after she had to change our room because she couldn't make the key for our room. The day time clerk seems annoyed whenever we asked a questions. The bathroom clogged for no reason. I always tip the maid and usually you get an extra towel. Not here we got 2 that's it!! Cold tile floors in the rooms. No temperture control on A/C just on and off. The maid made the bed(not change the sheets just made it) dropped off 2 towels and that was room service. Oh and the church bells!! Everyday! I've paid less at other hotels and got much better service. I didn't expect a rtiz-carlton but at least better than a super 8 motel. Oh and the pool forget it! They shouldn't even have it listed because it's just a large bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between cheap and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: MrJonson
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap brand name hotel. It's clean and it gets the job done. The rooms had a flair of Spanish architecture, but the dÃ©cor and the furniture just felt cheap. They offer free wi-fi, but the thick concrete walls will only let it work in just part of the first floor. We didn't try the pool, which looked claustrophobic being so small and surrounded by tall concrete walls, but it still looked just adequate for cooling off on a hot day. Most decent beaches are in neighboring towns about 15 to 30 minutes away, so it might come in handy. Unless you're on a really tight budget, avoid their lame continental breakfast. Just across the street you can go to one of the best bakeries in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: kutekay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the HOJO for a week. We really enjoyed ourselves. The only complaint we would have had if we weren't awake already is .....that two out of the seven days we were there...we heard the church bells ring at about 7 am....which did not bother us at all because we were up by that time to hit the beach...and you cannot hold the hotel responsible for that...PS...if your on vacation theres is no time to sleep.... When we reached the hotel everyone was very welcoming and helpful...my bf and I forgot to bring toothpaste and razors..the staff had no problem providing us with some. The free breakfast kinda sucked...coffee and bread...but what can you expect...its FREE....If you are not cheap .....just buy a meal....they make GREAT sandwiches.... As for the reviews complaining about EVERYTHING...If you wanted to have your a** kissed then you should have paid more than $70 a night....Another thing that might be annoying is that metal plate on the street...I did hear it make a loud noise each time a car passed...but only when I was out side on the street...my advice is to do what we did...we read the reviews and found out about it before hand ....we called the hotel and asked for a room by the staircase....which is on the opposite side of the street....we slept like babies...the A/C in the room was great we did not feel the 90 degree weather at all....and also you should pay the 4.50 per day for parking....it gets so busy during the morning it is damn near impossible to find parking...but we paid for it...so no headaches for us....the hotel is right near the plaza...which looks beautiful at night....to sum it up...great people, great service, clean rooms, free ice (trust me you will need it)....great food nearby....all for 71.60....not bad..

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: TinaCara
Reviews.Content: We spent $91 including room, taxes, parking fee ($4.50) and a complimentary continental breakfast at a bakery across the street. The room was definitely not the nicest we have ever been in but it is the Howard Johnson so we were expecting something very basic. And it was. But the decor of the hotel was very charming given that it is a converted monastery. The girl at the front desk called a taxi for us, per our request, and it turned out that the taxi driver was awesome (Ralph at White Taxi Co) and ended up driving us to a few places. The location was great being that it is next to the town square and close to a few bars. The downside was the noise from the street and the cathedral (next door) morning bells/music was so loud, my husband thought he had to have been dreaming. We didn't get to use the pool since it was too late. It would have been nice if the pool was open later. Overall, though, we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SantiagoPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Bed not very comfortable. The pool is very small about 12 x 12 and 3' 6" deep.

Reviews.Title: “bad location”
Reviews.Author: nic516
Reviews.Content: ok,so my 1st problem was the fact that they had wireless internet,but only in the 'lobby' which was OUTSIDE,not indoors,so ofcourse you feel unsafe hanging out in an outside lobby late night just to be on your laptop. 2nd off,its VERY loud downtown.we were awaken with all the noise at 9am after only 3-4 hrs of sleep. the pool is tiny.the free breakfast is across the street. 3rd thing was the 1 washer and dryer they had,wasnt working,so no way to wash clothes. the staff was very nice and polite. it definately wasnt worth $110 a night,the location was very bad,and rugged area. we had to 'find' places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: maggy376
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel stay for 2 nights, but after 5 minutes in the lobby, I realized I could not stay there for more than 1 night. First of all, the pictures on Expedia look as they were enhanced, so please don't be fooled. The hotel is dirty,rooms and pool are tiny and the "complimentary breakfast" is awful.Also,the location is very unsafe,rowdy, with alot of homeless people on street corners asking for money. I must say the hotel staff was nice. But the location and conditions is the worse.Pay the extra $50 a night and stay somewhere decent.

Reviews.Title: “Above my expectations”
Reviews.Author: THECABRERAS
Reviews.Content: 1- Excellent location, close to everything. 2- Very attentive staff, corteous. 3- Very clean, well kept facility, good room facilities, simple but with good taste. 4- I will stay there again and reccommend it to all my friends and relatives. 5- For me is the best to stay in the charmed city of Mayaguez

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, fair price.”
Reviews.Author: emil_abreu
Reviews.Content: Very good place to stay in Mayaguez: nice location, friendly staff, clean decent room, and very clean bathroom. Good complimentary breakfast in bakery across the street, and parking is only a few steps from the main entrance. Swiming pool is small, but nice. Hotel has a vending room wth sodas, snacks, coin-laundry and ice machine (free). The hotel looks renovated and nice, no complaints. The only bad thing is the noise from the adjacent streets; but, if you close the door and turn on the air conditioned, you'll be fine. I tried to book my room over the internet and it seemed sold out, I called the hotel and they were able to make a reservation for me. Will defnitively stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Mayaguez”
Reviews.Author: Eg-viaje
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were cozy and clean. We loved the breakfast coupons for the bakery across the street, took many trips there during the day. The only negative was that the area was too loud at night with car radios blaring, motorcycles and a dance club a few doors down. It was just awful. We bought ear plugs but they didnt help. Staff gave us a different room but you could still hear the noise. The staff was extremly pleasant and knowledgeable, they gave great directions and suggested many places to hang out for the day. The pool was clean but nothing special. We would not stay there again due to the noise level.

Reviews.Title: “So, so...”
Reviews.Author: RobertGiacommetti
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, make sure you bring ear plugs. The hotel is in the middle of the city, right next to Plaza de Colon and the Cathedral, and the noise at night time can be very loud. T Two problems: 1. Before making my reservation on the web, I called several times and the phone rang over 25 times and nobody answered. The same problem occurred while staying there, when someone was trying to reach me. Bring your cell phone. 2. Mosquitoes in the room. I don't know why, or where they were coming from, but even after I thought I had killed them all, more resurfaced. The lady at the front desk - whose name I can't remember - was fantastic, an ideal person to have in a front desk. The rooms are very clean, the bathroom is also VERY clean and nice, and overall, I would stay here again if I ever find myself in Mayaguez.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Zwithapggb
Reviews.Content: If you want a base to explore the western side of PR, Mayaguez is as central as it gets. The HoJos is what you would expect: clean, functional, well run. Mayaguez isn't the garden spot of Puerto Rico, but the Plaza is nice, and the hotel has character. There's plenty to eat, and all the shops and services you need nearby. If what you are looking for is a base of operations which lets you get around the west of the island, and is inexpensive, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not large but still very clean and comfortable. We paid $85 a night. The television was resting on the desk in front of the bed so there is not a lot of space to put items you would normally leave on a desk at your hotel. The furniture is cedarwood (I think) and creates a nice smell. Mayaguez is a great jumping off point for the western part of the island. We stayed here and made day trips to Cabo Rojo, Boqueron, La Parguera and Rincon. I wish we had more than a couple of days. The building itself is very nice, the rooms all sit inside of an open walkway. They do offer a continental breakfast with the bakery across the street which is sparse but we still got a good breakfast there under $5. Be advised, the breakfast tortilla on the menu is actually an omelet. The restaurant also serves lunch and dinner dishes a la carte and is very busy with locals througout the day. Ladies if you have the chance and the time, there is shop up the block owned by a designer who makes custom bathing suits starting at about $70. The pool and pool area are very small. We did experience more panhandling than in San Juan. If you're concerned about theft there is a security guard posted at the hotel 24 hrs and they do have secure fencing around the building gates. There is a guest laundry but the dryer doesn't work very well. I would definitely stay here again when I go back to Mayaguez.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Downtown Mayaguez
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Mendez Vigo 70 Este | Mayaguez Plaza / Cathedral, Mayaguez 00680, Puerto Rico
